caseTitle: Mureed Sultan and another v. The State thr. Prosecutor General, Punjab and another
tagline: Per Qazi Faez Isa, J (Additional Note): Offences prescribed in terms of section 345, Cr.P.C. can be compounded, but the composition of such offences has to be in terms of subsection (6) of section 345 which stipulates that it "shall have the effect of an acquittal" and not that it will be an acquittal or that an acquittal ensues. Convicted murderers can only be acquitted by a court of competent jurisdiction and after application of mind by judges. Acquittal cannot be secured, or granted for that matter, whilst accepting an application under section 345 of Cr.P.C.
